1092686567221665798.text: 11/ Or accept being fired by committee or DAO vote. As long as system participants are dependent on capital to survive, this will happen, no matter how peaceful and welcoming a mission sounds. No matter how much an organization wants to change the world.

1092686565627883522.text: 10/ It’s selfish, as there is greater concern for personal stability and happiness vs. the stability and longevity of the collective. Being cognizant of when you should quit and exit the system should hence be something that is trained, if we want worker-autonomy, truly.

1092686564033990657.text: 9/ Regardless of being able to easily enter/exit a decentralized system, if other people’s livelihoods are dependent on the success of the organization, and active participants slow down progress & risk bringing the collective down is simply taking advantage of the system.

1092686562419265537.text: 8/ Will smart contracts now be our boss? Will we become slaves to the machine? We don’t need to be. I think everyone should still expect that being let go or fired can still occur in an environment of “worker-autonomy” or open source & shouldn’t let this be a machine desicision.

1092686560800243712.text: 7/ The same should be applied to DAOs that want to promote worker-autonomy. There also need to be measures of accountability in place if we don’t have real bosses.

1092686559084724224.text: 6/ Can DAOs change this? I don’t know. But what I have learned is that establishing clear values, purpose and a mission for an organization is something that should not just be swept under the rug during the founding phases.

1092686556576604160.text: 5/ This is why cooperatives are generally not that prevalent. One is due to lack of access to capital for startup costs. The other I think is that too much freedom (and stubbornness to go out of one’s comfort zone) ends up being what stands in the way of success.

1092686554911436800.text: 4/ If we don’t realize that sacrifices need to be made along the way during the course of “worker-autonomy” we will never reach the dream of full-autonomy... which can only come once the workforce prioritizes robots and AI development.

1092686553439182848.text: 3/ Full autonomy to do whatever you want and whenever you want is a myth in this world where there is a dependency on capital to survive.

1092686551694364672.text: 2/ Another is how difficult it is to reach consensus for everyone to feel “fully autonomous” with the activities and duties that they may need to perform, and when they perform them.

1092686548217282561.text: 1/ One problem of why flat organizations are inefficient and much slower than existing organizations is due to the lack of accountability (people taking for granted their position, feeling low risk of being let go)
